events.name: Women Techmakers Hamburg Opening Talk
events.description:
**Important: Make sure to use your full name for the name badges that are necessary to enter**

Ladies, join the opening talk of the new Women Techmakers chapter in Hamburg. We are part of the global Women Techmakers initiative, powered by Google Developer Groups (GDG). During the next months we will cover different aspects of the tech side of the startups (i.e. backend, frontend and SDK). We will have different intro lectures followed by beginners workshops. Everything will take place all in the Hamburg Google offices. The purpose is to allow those who are less acquainted to learn more, and to those who are already in to expand their knowledge.

Join us for the opening event, with drinks and snacks, to celebrate the start of the program in Hamburg. The lecture will cover the eco-system and introduce the structure, and then we will chat, get to know each other and network.

About the program:

Women Techmakers is Google’s brand and global program for women in technology. Women Techmakers provides visibility, community, and resources for women in technology to drive innovation and participation in the field. Women Techmakers events are designed to promote an environment of inclusivity for women in technology, as well as celebrate women leading the industry. We want to advance, grow, and celebrate women developers, designers, and technology entrepreneurs.

https://www.womentechmakers.com

events.name: Study Jam on Android Development
events.description:
Google Developers Study Jams is a free series of global, community-run, in-person study groups. The current Study Jams series is presented in partnership with Udacity and will follow their Android for Beginners curriculum.

So this time our Women Techmakers Meetup will be an off-topic event on Android Programming.  Men are explicitly invited and we will hopefully work together in mixed teams!

You find all information on Study Jams here: http://developerstudyjams.com/

We will be doing a Udacity class together on this day https://www.udacity.com/account/affiliate/GoogleStudyJams.

Ideally you'll attend this if you find the time to continue with the udacity course after our event at home in self study (we will be there to help).

This is how we'll work during the study jams:

• At home: watch the beginning of the video until Coffee break challenge 1

• In class: recap the material, answer the quiz and continue with the udacity class

• Each participant works on their own project in their own pace 

• Instructors are around to help

What you will get:

- Personal tutoring on the course material

- Community setting to support course learning

- Swag pack

- Google-offered Study Jams completion certificate.   

- Discount on the Android Nanodegree upon course completion

- Opportunity to join Google Launchpad with completed app, pending app quality

See you then, Anja

events.name: Organizing Analytics around launching a new Project
events.description:
**Important: We need your full names to enter the google office. We will send out a google form shortly before. Please make sure to check your meetup messages**

Now that we have successfully built and launched our new website www.moinworld.de it is time to add new features and optimize our content in the next meetups. 

With analytics software we can track our user's behavior, and learn more about who they actually are to improve our content, so that our users will spend more time on our website and we can reach our website's goals.

In this talk we are going to learn about analytics tools like Google Analytics, Mixpanel, and Inspectlet. We will learn what these tools are, how to start working with them, and what kind of value we can get out of them. 

This session will be held by Olga Kostova. She is a Digital Web Analyst and is coming all the way from Odessa, Ukraine. She is consulting with a German company in Hamburg right now. 

See you soon!

events.name: Git & Github: why you should use Version Control in Software Development
events.description:
**Important: Please help us with badging and sign up for this event with your full name by answering the question during RSVP**

Whether you’re just starting out or already a full time developer, you know that GitHub is where you need to be. But, why are programmers so excited about GitHub? We already had a session on Git and Github in May, but as it is so important for you to be able to work with this tool we will have a second session on this topic. Do not worry if you could not attend the first session.

Git is an open source version control software. It allows more than one person to safely work on the same project without interfering with each other.

It is a version control software allows you to have “versions” of a project, which show the changes that were made to the code over time, and allows you to backtrack if necessary and undo those changes. This ability alone – of being able to compare two versions or reverse changes, makes it fairly invaluable when working on larger projects.

Although you can run your own Git server locally,

Github

is both a remote server, a community of developers, and a graphical web interface for managing your Git project. It’s free to use for up to 5 public repositories – that is, when anyone can view or fork your code – with low cost plans for private projects.

Please bring:

- your laptop

- create an account with github 

https://github.com/

- download the desktop version of git 

https://desktop.github.com/

- print out and bring with you the cheat sheet:

https://education.github.com/git-cheat-sheet-education.pdf

- your headphones, as we will be working with code academy/udacity

events.name: Talent and Business Development: Indication Error through unconscious Bias
events.description:
Gender equality in Tech seems like a far away goal if we look back at most of the tech Meetups lacking female participation. If we take a look at the industry it sometimes seems like we are taking one step forward and two steps back. Are we trying to achieve something impossible? Should we just give up?

In January we have successfully launched Women Techmakers with many women participating and interested in tech so far.

In this Meetup we want to talk about how closing the gender gap leads to increasing business opportunities and lets us stay ahead of the competition. It is the most effective tool to counter the demographic change.

AGENDA:

18:30-19:00 Drinks and Snacks

19:00-19:10 Welcome: Anja Schumann (Women Techmakers Hamburg)

19:10-19:30 Googles Developer and Community Program: Tim Messerschmidt (Developer Relations at Google)

19:30-20:30 Talent Development & Unconscious bias Talk: Dr. Nicola Byok (Byok Diversity Strategien)      

20:30-22:00 Tombola & Networking over Drinks

About Dr. Nicola Byok

Dr. Byok is a consultant to companies and law firms on diversity strategies. She has a degree in Law from Hamburg University, a degree inEgyptology from Yale, and her Ph.D. degree from Berlin University. Prior to founding her own business she was the first Diversity Officer at Bucerius Law School in Hamburg. In her research and her work she focuses on the economic advantages of diversity. 

http://www.byok-divstrat.de/

Badging:

Please help us with badging and sign-up for this Meetup with your full name by answering the question during RSVP. That way we can print out the badges ahead of time and speed up the sign-in process.  Thanks! 

We're raffling off tickets for the code talks www.codetalks.de  and O'Reilly Books at the end of the Meetup.

Books sponsored by:

events.name: Android Study Jam
events.description:
Ever wanted to learn how to program Apps?

This will be a study group where everybody will work at her own pace doing the udacity online tutorial. Find out that it is more fun to study in a group. Make sure to bring your headphones to be able to listen to the audio.

Some of you already started the class with us in May other might just want to start. Anything is fine.

https://www.udacity.com/course/android-development-for-beginners--ud837

Learn the basics of Android and Java programming, and take the first step on your journey to becoming an Android developer!

This course is designed for students who are new to programming, and want to learn how to build Android apps. You don’t need any programming experience to take this course. If you’ve been using a smartphone to surf the web and chat with friends, then you’re our perfect target student!

Learning anything new can be tough. We will walk you through the process of making Android apps, but to get the most out of this course, you must bring your enthusiasm for learning, and budget time on your calendar to learn with us.

By the end of the course, you’ll build two simple (but powerful) apps that you can share with your friends. We also hope that you will learn enough through this course to decide how best to continue your journey as an Android app developer, if you're interesting in pursuing such a path.

events.name: Firebase: Building Apps the easy way II
events.description:
This will be the second part of our Firebase workshop and introduction. You can also attend if you did not make it to the first part.

Agenda:

- 18:30-19:00 Doors open

- 19:00-19:10 Welcome (Anja Schumann, Women Techmakers Hamburg)

- 19:10-21:30 Use Firebase Auth & Firebase Realtime Database to add powerful functions to your App in an easy way (Hasan Hosgel, GDG Android Berlin & Martin Thielecke GDG Hamburg)

- 21:30-22:00 Closing

We have Google Expert Speaker Hasan Hosgel joining us this time.

Hasan is a Senior Android Developer at Immobilienscout24 and Co-Organizer of the Berlin Android GDG chapter.

He is a dedicated Android developer with over fiveteen years of professional programming experience. Since 2010 doing all day long Android application development.

Continuous improvement of the architecture, performance and also quality are his dedication. Thats why he is here to talk about Firebase.

We had a talk on Firebase already last week. This time we will cover different perspectives and the questions from last time.

events.name: Meet Hamburg's Start Ups and get inspired
events.description:
It's time to grow and advance more female technology entrepreneurs!

We will have start ups from Hamburg presenting themselves and sharing their story. We will also present a new mentoring program designed to help you when starting your own company.

Afterwards we will have some time to chat with the founders and get to know their teams.

These are the teams you will get to network with this time:

Shelf Sailor

Shelf Sailors is like an airbnb for storage. They provide storage at a friendly neighbour's home. Storage hosts can turn the extra space into cash. Shelf Sailor connects people who have space with those wo need it.

Miriam Bundel, CEO at Shelf Sailor will tell us about how you can start a company from a start up weekend, how to build an MVP, how to find investors and how her company is solving your problem.

FASHION CLOUD

Fashion Cloud is also a startup from Hamburg, that enables the collaboration between fashion brands and local retailers.  130 of the most important brands in the fashion industry are now sharing their material with their retail partners via Fashion Clouds platform, which officially launched in the beginning of 2016.
FASHION CLOUD is located in the middle of the Hafencity and currently we are a team of 13,  expanding to 25 by the end of this year.

The CTO  & founder Florian Klemt is going to present FASHION CLOUD's JavaScript focused Techstack and will share some interesting tips for all the JS-interested people. One of the co-founders, Martin Brücher, will then share some private insights and explain how FASHION CLOUD has validated its business model in a pretty short period of time by using the Lean Startup Method.

Sant Pauli Patrons Program

The “Silicon Pauli Patrons Program” (SPPP) is a development program that connects experienced creatives with young startups. SPPP helps founders design and develop their digital products by offering one day of work per month for free. Nicolas Kittner, founder of Silicon Pauli, will share more details about his program when we get together on the 31st. 

Here's our timeline:

18:45 Doors open

19:15 Welcome (Anja Schumann, Founder Women Techmakers Hamburg)

19:20 The Story behind Shelfsailor a Start Up founded at Start Up Weekend (Miriam Bundel, CEO Shelfsailor)

19:40 BREAK

19:50 The Story behind Fashion Cloud (Martin Brücher, CEO Fashion Cloud & Florian Klemt, CTO Fashion Cloud)

20:15 Get mentoring for free with the Silicon Pauli Patrons Program (Nicolas Kittner, Founder SPP)

20:30 Time to network and share ideas

21:30 Closing

events.name: Turbocharging your Firebase app with the Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
You have developed your first Firebase app and its doing great, however, even with all the great features Firebase offers, as your compute and data needs grow you start to realize that maybe there should be a better/cheaper way to do some things... and actually there is, with Google Cloud Platform. During this talk you’ll see how to take advantages of some of the GCP services to take what you’ve built on top of Firebase to the next level and have the best of both worlds.

Our Speaker this time: David @dcifuen is a software engineer at Zalando SE and Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Cloud Platform based in Berlin, Germany. For the past few years, he's been developing and deploying to the cloud IoT and enterprise software projects. He is also passionate about agile methodologies, particularly Scrum. In his spare time he enjoys travelling, running and road cycling.

events.name: Android Study Jam
events.description:
Ever wanted to learn how to program Apps?

This will be a study group where everybody will work at her own pace doing the udacity online tutorial. Find out that it is more fun to study in a group. Make sure to bring your headphones to be able to listen to the audio.

Some of you already started the class with us in May other might just want to start. Anything is fine.

https://www.udacity.com/course/android-development-for-beginners--ud837

Learn the basics of Android and Java programming, and take the first step on your journey to becoming an Android developer!

This course is designed for students who are new to programming, and want to learn how to build Android apps. You don’t need any programming experience to take this course. If you’ve been using a smartphone to surf the web and chat with friends, then you’re our perfect target student!

Learning anything new can be tough. We will walk you through the process of making Android apps, but to get the most out of this course, you must bring your enthusiasm for learning, and budget time on your calendar to learn with us.

By the end of the course, you’ll build two simple (but powerful) apps that you can share with your friends. We also hope that you will learn enough through this course to decide how best to continue your journey as an Android app developer, if you're interesting in pursuing such a path.

events.name: Using Facebook Ads
events.description:
Ever wanted to know more about how Facebook ads work? This Meetup is about understanding exactly that: from the advertising auction in which ads are selected, to setting up your own ads and assessing ad performance. We will work with the Women Techmakers’ Facebook Page as an example, with learnings that can be extended to your own business. 

The session will be held by Georgina Sheedy-Collier from Auction & Delivery Science at Facebook.

Georgina is a strong advocate of the growth of women in STEM and is involved with Women in Tech communities in both the U.K and Germany. Currently, Georgina works in Data Analytics at Facebook, to understand how to improve the value of Facebook advertising for both advertisers and people using the platform. Initially trained as a Physicist, her experience with data began 8 years ago at the UK’s National Physical Laboratory, working internationally on an EU Research Project. Since then, she has worked with an array of organisations, including Oxford University Particle Physics, the UK Parliamentary Office of Science and Technology and the Institute for Computational Cosmology, before moving into commercial roles at Groupon and Facebook – in London, Berlin and Hamburg.

events.name: IoT Workshop: Build a Lego Smart Home using Firebase
events.description:
*This workshop is part of our devfest, see information below on how to get tickets & make sure to be early as the workshop is open to all dev fest attendants*

Learn more about the Internet of Things using your favourite childhood toy, Lego. We will build a smarthome with Lego and equip it with sensors. To make sense of the data our sensors are sending and interact with the user we'll use a tiny computer or microcontroller, the Wio Link board. It is an ESP8266 based open-source Wi-Fi development board to create IoT applications. We are going to connect the board and we are persisting the data to our online realtime Database Firebase. The board will receive the information from the sensors and push them to the database in the cloud. Feel free to build other applications on top of this.

Please purchase a ticket: hamburg.devfest.de. Use the code "WomenTech16" if you are female to get a free ticket from us.

Find out more about us at www.moinworld.de

events.name: SEO Basics - Search Engine Optimization of Moinworld.de
events.description:
The Women Techmaker meetup on October 19th 2016 will be all about Search Engine Optimization. We will try to cover the most important SEO basic while learning why Search Engine Optimization is necessary in general or at least a considerable method for websites.

Join our tour through many important onpage factors and helpful tools and plugins you can use in your daily work. Of course moinworld.de will be a great example, along with other hand-selected cases. So if you want to learn about

· Snippet optimization

· HTML structure

· HTTP status codes

· URL structure

and other SEO relevant topics, you have come to the right place.

We will also address offpage optimization and general strategic questions.

Our goal is to give you a first but thorough overview when it comes Search Engine Optimization.

The meetup will be presented by Anne Sönksen from OTTO and Anita Böhm from Wingmen Online Marketing. Both of them have some years of experience when it comes to SEO as Inhouse SEO Managers as well as SEO Consultants and are happy to share their knowledge

events.name: Start Up Talks II
events.description:
It's time for another Entrepreneurs Session! We have App Camps, Jimdo, Baqend and EatClever this time with us!

We will start with hearing a little bit of their story and will then have a fireside chat where Anja will be interviewing the founders and you will also get to ask all questions that you have.

18:30 Doors open

19:00 Welcome  (Anja Schumann, Founder Women Techmakers Hamburg)

19:05 App Camps: Inspire teachers, children & parents to code (Dr. Diana Knodel, Founder App Camps)

App Camps shares a similar mission as we are. They believe that every student should have the chance to learn about coding: Girls, boys, disadvantaged students and those who would not think they are able to code. We want to show that coding is more than letters and numbers: It’s fun, it’s creative and it is a powerful tool to bring own ideas to life. What does App Camps do? App Camps brings coding into the classroom!

Dr. Diana Knodel has a background in computer science, psychology and educational research. She worked as a software engineer, product manager and team lead in academia and the IT sector before founding App Camps. In 2014 Edition F and D64 named her as one of the 25 leading women in Germany for the digital future.

19:20 Jimdo: How to manage growth (Matthias Henze, Co-Founder Jimdo)

As one of Hamburg's "Vorzeige"-Start-Ups Jimdo is making the lives of many of easier with offering a toolbox for creating websites.

Matthias Henze studied Business Administration in Kiel and Gothenburg before founding Jimdo together with Fridtjof Detzner and Christian Springub. The three of them moved into an old farmhouse owned by Fridtjof’s parents to found their first company in 2004, followed by Jimdo in 2007. Matthias is mainly taking care of Jimdo’s marketing activities and it’s international teams since Jimdo is fully localized in 9 languages. He is focused on building a forward thinking and sustainable company and believes that transparency, communication, flexibility and fun help to provide the stability necessary to deal with big changes.

19:35 - Break - 10 min-

19.45: Baqend: the German answer to Firebase (Felix Gessert, CEO Baqend)

The Baqend GmbH (founded in July 2014) develops the Backend-as-a-Service platform Baqend, which leverages new research results to achieve unique benefits. The platform empowers customers to develop data-driven websites and mobile apps with higher productivity while at the same time guaranteeing unprecedented performance in terms of response times and scalability. 

20:00 EatClever: How to start a Food Startup our of Startup Weekend ( Dennis Müller, EatClever)

Eat Clever is a food delivery service that focuses on the delivery of healthy food. 

20:15 Break- 15 min-

20:30 Fireside Chat with the Founders ( Diana, Matthias, Hannes, Dennis & Anja)

21:00 Networking & Closing

Speaker and his talk:

Tom Hutter


Tom is system administrator since 1998. Currently self employed as Freelancer. He has worked with companies such as: Volkswagen AG, Hewlett-Packard, Avalog AG, Unicredit Leasing GmbH, easy2coach GmbH, among others.

Tom’s Skills

- Unix: Linux (Debian, Ubuntu, Redhat, Suse), HP-UX, Solaris
- Webserver: apache, nginx, tomcat, thin
- Databases: PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, MongoDB
- Virtualization: Xen, VirtualBox, Docker
- Programming languages: Shell, Perl, Ruby
- Groupware: SOGo, Scalix
- Monitoring: Zabbix

Tom’s Talk

Basic terms:
- What‘s docker?
- Why docker?
- Which new terms should I know?

Basic principles:
- What's different in docker?
- docker basics – networking, volumes & stacked file system

Some first examples:
- Creating our first image
- Running our first container

Ulrike Rausch

Berlin-based type designer and letterer Ulrike Rausch holds a Bachelor of Arts in Communication Design from Potsdam University of Applied Science (Germany).

In 2009 Ulrike founded her own type foundry called LiebeFonts, providing high-quality typefaces and hand-crafted letterings with a charming personality and obsessive attention to detail.

Website: http://liebefonts.com/

Ulrike’s Talk

Ulrike will show how she designs typefaces and how she builds fonts. Ulrike will also demonstrate how nerdy OpenType programming adds just the right analog touch to her handwriting style. You will learn how to use pro fonts like a pro—no matter if you use layout software like Adobe InDesign or a standard word processor like Microsoft Word.

Renate Wünschl

Renate Wünschl started as a software engineer in 1995. She developed CD-Rom games for brands like Löwenzahn, TKKG, Siebenstein and Fritz & Fertig.

Since 2010 she creates iPhone/iPad apps e.g. Conni (Carlsen Verlag). Many of her edutainment games received awards. 

She also works as a freelance developer and consultant. She loves to learn and share her knowledge. Renate lives with her husband and two kids in Hamburg.

Twitter: @cocoa_nib

Renate’s Talk

Renate will tell about her life as a developer, woman and mom. She will also show you how easy it is, to make an iMessage Sticker Pack app.

Speakers and their talks:

Elisabeth Bauer (Google Germany)

Elisabeth Bauer started at Google in early 2010 and is now responsible for coordinating Strategic European Partnerships in relation to product integrations such as AMP or Google Assistant.

From 2014 to 2016, she was Head of Google Play Kiosk in Germany, Austria and Switzerland following her role as Key Account Manager supporting publishing partners in the UK, Netherlands and Germany. Since 2015, she has also been promoting the open source project AMP (Accelerated Mobile Pages, ampproject.org).

Elisabeth Bauer holds a Master's degree in International Communication studying in Cologne, Barcelona and Sydney. After nearly three years at Google Ireland Ltd. she moved back to Germany in late 2012 and has been living and working in Hamburg ever since.

Website: https://www.ampproject.org/

Elisabeth’s Talk

Dr. Carola Lilienthal, CEO WPS - Workplace Solutions GmbH & Senior Software Architect

Carola Lilienthal studied computer science at the University of Hamburg from 1988 to 1995, and in 2008 she received her doctoral degree in computer science at the University of Hamburg (Supervising Professors: Christiane Floyd and Claus Lewerentz). Today, Dr. Carola Lilienthal is managing director of WPS - Workplace Solutions GmbH and is responsible for the department of software architecture.

Since 2003, Dr. Carola Lilienthal has been analyzing architecture in Java, C #, C ++, ABAP and PHP throughout Germany, and advising development teams on how to improve the longevity of their software systems. She is particularly interested in the education of software architects, which is why she is an active member of iSAQB, the International Software Architecture Quality Board e.V. and regularly disseminates her knowledge at conferences, in articles and training courses.

Birgitta Boeckeler, Lead Developer - Thoughtworks

events.name: Behaviour Driven Development with Serenity
events.description:
* Sign up via Meetup or www.moinworld.de, 10 EUR will be invested in Food and Drinks*

This evening will be around Quality Assurance and Behaviour Driven Development. We will dive deeper into Serenity, a tool that is commonly used for Testing.

Behaviour Driven Development or BDD, is a development approach where team members explore, and build a shared understanding of application requirements through conversations around examples.

In Agile teams practicing BDD is often done before or early on in a sprint, in a special meeting sometimes called "the three amigos" or "the three-way handshake", where (at least) a BA (Business Analyst, Product Owner/Manager), a developer and a tester get together to work through examples from the acceptance criteria. The examples are then discussed by concrete illustrations of how the system should work, or how a user might use a feature. They help provoke discussion, uncovering assumptions and omissions that would have otherwise lead the development team into error further down the track.

Serenity BDD is an open source library that aims to make the idea of living documentation a reality. Serenity BDD helps you write cleaner and more maintainable automated acceptance and regression tests faster. Serenity also uses the test results to produce illustrated, narrative reports that document and describe what your application does and how it works. Serenity tells you not only what tests have been executed, but more importantly, what requirements have been tested.

To get the most out of Serenity BDD, it is useful to understand some of the basic Serenity BDD behind Behaviour Driven Development and Automated Acceptance Testing.

Serenity BDD is commonly used for both Automated Acceptance Tests and Regression Tests, and the principles discussed here apply, with minor variations, to both.

Agenda:

We will start with a presentation about Serenity and BDD and then do a Demo

Our Speaker:


Alina Rotariu

Alina about herself: "I am a Quality Specialist at Otto, where i am focusing on setting up a good quality mindset, first of all, inside the team and then inside the project, being present in each step of the product's lifecycle. I moved to Hamburg 4 years ago and I consider this change to be an opportunity for me to develop myself both in career and personal level. My free time i enjoy spending it with my husband and my dog"

events.name: Web-Entwicklung mit Ruby on Rails
events.description:
* RSVP to let us know if you are interested. If we have more people wanting to attend than space there will be a second RSVP necessary.

This workshop will be in German language!

Was ist Rails?

Rails ist ein Framework für die objekt-orientierte Programmiersprache Ruby, mit dem sich relativ leicht komplexe Web-Anwendungen umsetzen lassen. Ob Customer Relationship Management, Online-Shop oder Backend-API für mobile Apps: Rails schafft die Verknüpfung von der Datenbank-Tabelle zur gewünschten Darstellung und Bearbeitung im Browser oder über andere Schnittstellen. Das Open-Source- und Community-basierte Baukastensystem der so genannten Gems und das ActiveRecord-Datenmuster von Rails setzen auf Rubys umfangreiche Libraries und gut lesbare Syntax auf. Unterstützt durch Konventionen für die Namensgebung von Dateien lassen sich Anforderungen schnell umsetzen und auch die Einarbeitung in bestehende Projekte ist mit ein wenig Erfahrung relativ leicht möglich.

Was machen wir in diesem Workshop?

Diese Veranstaltung möchte den Teilnehmerinnen einen groben Überblick über den Kosmos von Ruby on Rails geben, illustriert durch Beispiele aus der Praxis der AKRA GmbH, die bereits eine Vielzahl von Projekten mit dieser schönen Sprache umgesetzt und betreut hat.

Wie könnt ihr danach weitermachen?

Der Workshop wird mit einem Hands-on-Ruby-Kurs von MOINWORLD e.V. in den Folgewochen fortgesetzt. Basiskenntnisse im Bereich HTML & CSS werden vorausgesetzt, ein Grundverständnis von Datenbanken ist von Vorteil.

Ablauf:

Pause mit Pizza ca. 20 Uhr bis 20:30

Ende ca. 21.30 Uhr

Verfügbare Plätze: 10

Birte Goldt entwickelt seit 2012 individuelle Web-Anwendungen für Geschäftskunden bei dem IT-Dienstleister AKRA GmbH in Hamburg. Vor ihrem Quereinstieg in die Software-Entwicklung hat die studierte Politologin als Community Managerin für die epublica GmbH gearbeitet. Nach der Geburt ihres Kindes im Jahre 2010 hat sie sich das Programmieren in Ruby on Rails mit Hilfe von Online-Kursen beigebracht und mit der Hamburger Rails-Girls-Gruppe Programmier-Workshops für Frauen organisiert.

events.name: TensorFlow summit after viewing party & workshop - DEEP DIVING TO DEEP LEARNING
events.description:
Google is doing a TensorFlow summit at The Computer History Museum, Mountain View, CA: https://www.tensorflow.org/dev-summit/. The TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around the world for a full day of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community.

Tensor Flow Dev Summit After-Viewing-Party

This Saturday you will have the option to watch some of the talks of the summit with us and meet our community and the team of esailors over breakfast and snacks. If you want to experiment with TensorFlow yourself you have the chance to participate in our workshop.

Tensor Flow Workshop:

For those of you who want to experiment with TensorFlow we will do a workshop.

- Level: A learning jam for people with little or no knowledge in machine learning.

- What we'll do in the workshop: The MLCC (Machine Learning Crash Course) intended to take you to the point that you can build a neural network model in TensorFlow. We will also discuss common errors, pitfalls, and understand tradeoffs.

- What to bring for the workshop: Laptop

Participation is FREE, but while we would love that everyone learns about TensorFlow, we have limited space at the venue that means we will have to short list some participants and will have a second sign up one day prior to the event. Please leave us your email-adress. Also only sign up if you have time during the whole day. We do not have the capacity to manage late arrivals.

Our host for this event will be esailors https://www.esailors.de/ .

Agenda:

10:00 - 11:00 Breakfast & Keynotes of TensorFlow Dev Summit
11: 15 - 13:00 Choose between Viewing Party and Workshop
13:00 - 14:00 Lunch
11:00 - 16:00 Continue with Viewing Party or Workshop

Prework:
If you are already excited, here are some tutorial to wet your appetite and help you get ready for the workshop:

Pandas: a tool that we will use for manipulating datasets:
Intro to Pandas: https://colab.research.google.com/notebooks/mlcc/intro_to_pandas.ipynb?hl=en

Python tutorial: It is advised that you will be familiar with python. Here is a nice tutorial to remind you of some important concepts:
https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/

events.name: Datapipelines @XING
events.description:
XING is collecting billions of datapoints each day. To make sense of this data someone has to gather it together and make it accessible to other services.

Our speaker tonight will be Tejashree Aher - Software Engineer at XING SE.

In her talk Teja will start off with what we mean when we are talking about Big Data, what are the challenges involved and why it is important.

She will also explain what kind of problems XING is solving by making use of big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Cassandra, batch and stream processing.

Part of her talk will also be a case study where she will talk about lessons learned and the challenges the team faced.

The main take-away from this talk will be a kind of cheat sheet that helps you choose the right strategy about which tools how to use when.

In the meanwhile get to know Teja here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3zqEGDWSsQ&list=PL22Le26y_hFa3YN7uv6QV3iVhfoWBZJnW&index=7

events.name: Let’s talk about Microservices
events.description:
Everyone seems doing Microservices these days. Are you interested in the topic but not entirely sure what it means to build a microservices? Are you curious how to apply the pattern in a real world project? Or you are working with microservices and interested to share experiences with other practitioners? Then this Meetup is for you. In her talks Nina and Susanne will give an introduction and share some hands on experience. Afterwards there will be time for questions and discussions around the topic.

Our Speakers:

Lisa is a consultant and software developer at ThoughtWorks. Lisa is a Software Developer with a background in project management and organisational development.
She strongly believes in self-organizing teams, autonomy to delivery and extreme programming. She has worked with backend- and frontend technologies as well as infrastructure as code.

Susanne is an independent tech consultant and was previously working as a startup CTO transforming their SaaS solution from monolith to microservices. She has a background in computer sciences and experience in software development for more than 15 years and regularly presents at international tech conferences.

AGENDA:

18:30 Drinks and Snacks

19:00 Microservices 101 (Lisa Junger)

In her talk Nina will outline what the major ideas and principles of microservices are. She will explain the characteristics of a microservice architecture and highlight the benefits and challenges that come with them.

19:30 Break

19:45 Microservices Lessons Learned (Susanne Kaiser)

The journey from monolith to microservices is different for every organization. A variety of challenges come with introducing microservices itself, but also organizational circumstances impacting the transformation that needed to be considered.

In this talk I would like to share some microservices lessons learned and what to watch out for if starting the journey again.

20:15 Networking / Sharing experiences

---------------------------------------

* As long as there is a waiting list female attendants will be preffered

events.name: Web Development with React JS
events.description:
**For this workshop you need to sign up via our website: https://moinworld.de/programmieren-lernen-fuer-anfaenger-in-hamburg/**

React is a very popular JavaScript library created by Facebook and used by many other industry leaders like Netflix, Airbnb, etc. It’s a library for building user interfaces. It introduces many new concepts about how to approach building complex user interfaces. We will explore the core concepts of how you can build apps with React. We will touch all the basics you need to know to start feeling comfortable using React.

How to prepare

To participate in the workshop you'll need some basic knowledge in web development: HTML, CSS and basic JavaScript or any other programming language. If you're a total beginner, there are many tutorials on the internet for Web development: HTML, CSS and JavaScript. You should get the grasp of how things work. Codecademy is a good place to start, since it provides a platform for coding while learning.

Times:

This is a two day workshop which starts September 2nd:
Sunday September 2nd 3pm - 7 pm
Sunday September 9th 3pm - 7 pm

--------------------------------------------------------------
Pay 20 Euros as a signal of your commitment. If you are a moinworld member you can participate for free. No-show funds support one of the next meetups. Tickets are not refundable.
--------------------------------------------------------------

events.name: The key to an innovative organization
events.description:
The hypothesis: Happy people create products that customer love. Happiness is a precondition for creativity and creative solutions lead to Innovations. And all that happens embedded in structures and processes.

In this talk, Sabrina Hauptman will talk about research and lessons learned about happiness, creativity, and innovation. She will give us an overview of methods and structures for product development and will mention general principles that can be applied to all types organizations to inspire you to make your organization better in following up on good ideas.

"Working in IT organizations and collaborating with organizations across industries, I realized that topics that come up frequently are things like, how to reduce stress and distraction, how to organize work and teams into self-organization, how to make ideas happen (cheap and efficient), without interfering with the delivery. Because ideas are not the problem."

Agenda
- Arrival and reception
- Interactive Talk
- Short Q&A Session
- Mingling and Networking

Our Speaker: Sabrina Hauptman

Throughout my career, I have been researching and experimenting in the field of innovation and creativity in scaled IT organizations and have built and grown a network of thought leaders and practitioners across industries to discuss shared challenges about organizations.
I have spent my professional career in large-scale IT organizations working as an (agile) Project Manager, Agile Coach, Organizational Designer and Innovation Manager. I worked for the professional network XING SE, the biggest German e-commerce retailer Otto GmbH & Co KG and most recently for the multinational travel agency eDreams ODIGEO
Today I am dedicated to Research in that field and in building a network across industries and organizations to discuss and tackle challenges that we all share and to spread ideas and skills.

Looking forward to sharing ideas with you soon, until then

stay tuned in our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/womentechmakershamburg/

or follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/eVmoinworld

or learn how to code and visit our website: www.moinworld.de

events.name: Building the world we want to live in - Start up Women Techmakers
events.description:
Entrepreneurship is about designing the world that you want to live in.

Don’t worry about what you think the business world laid out before you looks like. Stop and ask yourself what would make you happy. And design that… You’ll be amazed by how many will be drawn to somebody who is doing things differently and enabling others to do things differently.

"We live in a world where the default setting is always male. Design the world you want to live in. Because when we do that, the men will desperately want to be a part of that as well " (Cindy Gallop)

Let's be a garden for new ideas on this evening and meet cool people to work on the problems out there to solve.
-----------

OUR SPEAKER OF THE NIGHT WILL BE ALEXANDER RENNER – SENIOR PRODUCT MANAGER @ XING

Born and raised in the Brandenburg area in Germany, Alexander started studying first in Dresden and later at the Ulm University of Applied Science in the field of Digital Media.

While studying he was able to spend some time abroad in Memphis, Tennessee to work at the FedEx Institute of Technology with a focus on helping non-profit organizations. After completing his study in Ulm, he moved to Frankfurt to start working as a Designer and UX expert for digital products. He worked for companies such as Musicload and Deutsche Telekom. In 2014 Alexander was asked to take a new challenge and join XING in Hamburg. At XING Alexander has shifted roles and grew from interaction designer to a senior product manager and is a great value for the company. He recently started studying part-time again and is a big fan of working on IoT products & ideas in his spare time.

His background and knowledge in creating product concepts, design thinking and successful product releases make him a perfect speaker for our meet up. He will share his idea for product development and will guide us through the world of idea development, conceptual thinking and hands-on tips.

-----------

AGENDA:

18:00 Doors open & Snacks

18:45 Lightning Talk from Alexander Renner (Senior Product Manager XING SE): Getting Innovative Ideas off the Ground

19:15 Icebreaker

19:45 Presenting problems to solve (everyone can present)

a) how can we tackle the resource of women who want to get back into worklife
b) Getting girls interested in tech. Is designing robots for boys and then making a pink version the right approach?
c) How to build a platform for mentorship
d) hopefully more from your side

20:00 Team up: Groups working on ideas
21:30 Presenting ideas getting feedback from everyone

Looking forward to an inspiring evening!

events.name: Movie night: The Computers
events.description:
In celebration of Ada Lovelace Day, we are showing:
- a 15 min TEDx presentation by Zoe Philpott, "Ada Lovelace: The Original Women in Tech" followed by
- a 20 min documentary "The Computers", a story about six brilliant young women who programmed the first all-electronic, programmable computer, the ENIAC. More info about the documentary: http://eniacprogrammers.org/

Join us at XING, in celebrating this day and raising awareness of women who changed the world by making programming easier and more accessible.

-----------------

Ada Lovelace Day is an international celebration of the achievements of women in science, technology, engineering and maths (STEM). It aims to increase the profile of women in STEM and, in doing so, create new role models who will encourage more girls into STEM careers and support women already working in STEM.

*women only event*

Full Day Web Development Workshop with AngularJS

Who is it for?

Are you a woman interested in learning how to build web applications with the latest technologies? We have good news for you: We are holding a one-day workshop for beginners! It will take place on Saturday, October 20th, 2018 at eSailors Offices.

We believe that the IT industry will greatly benefit from bringing more women into technology. We want to give you an opportunity to learn how to program and become a programmer.

The workshop

During the workshop you will build and deploy your very first Angular Web Application! Angular is an open-source platform for building web application, developed by Google and the community. It gives various tools to easily create a dynamic, interactive app that can run on desktop browses, mobile and even robots!

How to prepare

To participate in the workshop you'll need some basic knowledge in web development: HTML, CSS and basic JavaScript or any other programming language. If you're a total beginner, there are many tutorials on the internet for Web development: HTML, CSS and JavaScript. You should get the grasp of how things work. Ruby on Rails is a web framework and it's built using the Ruby programming language. Ruby is designed to be infinitely flexible and empowering for programmers. We will be meeting at XING's beautiful office with snacks and drinks provided!

Leyla Kapi

###########

He's been developing for Android since the very first Android device was on the market, and has bootstrapped the efforts of silicon valley startups. Outside of work, Doug follows professional ice hockey and enjoys craft beer.

###########

Agenda:

Introduction Talk: 18:00 - 18:30
Firebase became well known for its original product: the Realtime Database. In October Firebase released Cloud Firestore, the second Database product to join the Firebase family. Come hear about what makes Cloud Firestore so exciting!

Codelab: 18:30 - 20:00
Build a restaurant recommendation app from scratch using Cloud Firestore and Firebase Authentication! In only an hour you'll learn how to set up a secure, performant mobile database for your app and query it with realtime updates.

Firestore Pro Tips: 20:00 - 20:30
Cloud Firestore is unlike any other database product on the market today. In this talk you'll learn what makes Firestore different how to use it effectively in your application.

events.name: Meet us @ Share Now/Car2Go to talk about Design & UX
events.description:
Welcome to our first Meetup together with our new partner Car2Go. It will also be the first Meetup for them as a new company (car2go + DriveNow). Come join us in their pretty amazing office for networking, pizza, drinks, chats & talks! This edition will be focused on Design & UX.

---------------------------
As always Sign Up over Meetup does not save you a spot. In order to participate you need to go to our website and register https://moinworld.de/developer-meetups-hamburg/
---------------------------

Speakers:

▶ Mar High, UI Designer, https://marhigh.com
Case study: Starting a design system with MOVU using Sketch, Abstract, Anima, and InVision

A design system is a web design and development strategy for complex digital products or products that will rapidly scale. In this talk, I’ll share my experience coaching Swiss startup MOVU to create a design system from scratch and detail the design team’s setup, challenges, and successes.

▶ Dennis Schmidt, Product Designer @ SHARE NOW, https://dennisschmidt.net
Speeding up Your Design Process with a Ui Library

▶ Indra Burkart, Senior User Experience Consultant bei eresult GmbH
How to include UX in an agile process

Getting continuously feedback from real users has often a low priority or is not considered necessary. I talked with experts who successfully included User Experience methods in their daily agile process. In this talk I will share these methods, how they can be included into an existing agile process and make UX Design a team effort.

See you soon..

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
This day you have the chance to get official Google training free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. You can earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and get additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

Each course has a codelab format and is 40 minutes long.

⏰ Agenda:

Start: 18:00

▶ Our speaker/guide for the codelab:

Andres L. Martinez-Ortiz
Almo is Head of Developer Program in Google's Engineering team for several countries in Europe. He is focused on driving the success of Google's developer products and the open web by creating a thriving ecosystem of 3rd party applications and businesses built on them. Closely with Product Management, Marketing, PR, Business Development, and others, he works with and supports developer communities, initiating activities that meet the needs of the innovation ecosystem. In addition, he meets with developers and partners in large companies, startups, universities and enterprises, promoting Open standards and Google technologies. He is also a member of IEEE, ACM, Linux Foundation and Computer Society.
@davilagrau

▶ What to bring:

- Laptop, Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.
- Laptop charger

The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, use Firefox or Chrome.

----------------------

❗ Sign up via moinworld https://ti.to/moinworld/codelab-signup

is required as we need name tags to enter the Google office and also we need to be able to manage no-shows!

----------------------

👋 Looking forward to seeing you soon!

events.name: Interactive session in computational thinking @ XING
events.description:
Technology is shaping how we do things for example how we go shopping, how we communicate with eachother, how we diagnose illnesses or how we collaborate and with whom on projects. The ability to extend our power of human thought with digital tools has become an essential part of our everyday lives and work. We all need to understand how, when, and where computers and other digital tools can help us solve problems, and we all need to know how to communicate with others who can assist us with computer-supported solutions.

Computational thinking is a problem solving process that includes formulating problems in a way a computer can execute them. This problem-solving process can be applied to a wide variety of problems in your daily life.

This evening we would like to explore the basic concepts of computational thinking by practical exercises.

AGENDA:
18:30 Doors open

19:00- 19:20 Welcome & Introduction to the Concept of Computational Thinking

19:30 - 20:15 Team up around computational thinking exercises (everybody is welcome to suggest tasks that help understand the basic concepts of decomposition, abstraction, pattern recognition and algorithm design in a hands-on way)

20:15 - 20:30 Feedback round

20:30 open end networking

events.name: Data Science Barcamp
events.description:
We are excited to announce our first data science barcamp! Already announced are Data Scientists from Check24, EOS, Google, Lotto24, XING and also the Data Science Team from SHARE NOW, the sponsor of the evening, will be present.

**************************************
As always Sign Up over Meetup does not save you a spot. In order to participate you need to go to our website and register https://moinworld.de/developer-meetups-hamburg/
**************************************

In the first part of the evening, Avaré Stewart, data scientist at Center of Analytics of the EOS Holding, will talk about how to improve your data science workflow.

In the second part, it is your turn! Participants have the chance to propose a barcamp session based on their interest in the field of data science. Topics might range from questions that you want to ask other data scientists to ideas that you want to share. Sessions offer a platform for interactive and spontaneous exchange and sign up will be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

Schedule:
18.30 Doors open
19.00 - 19.40 Talk Avaré and discussion
19.40 - 20.00 Networking and sign up for barcamp sessions
20.00 - 20.40 Barcamp
After 20.40 Networking

We look forward to see you!

events.name: Women Techmakers Summer Party @XING
events.description:
We want to celebrate two years partnership between XING SE and moinworld e.V. with you!

For this reason we will have a special evening planed. Xing Director of Engineering Uygar Sönmez and XING Product Manager Angela Kapdan will talk about the insides of how tech companies try to prepare and promote women for management positions (XINGs Female Learning Journey). Why women do hassle to do the step into a leading position, how the situation of women in tech looks statistically and how we experienced it personally.

Starting into the third year we would also like to hear your feedback and suggestions for future meetups.

Agenda

18:30 Roof Terrasse Doors open & Surprise - Drinks and Snacks

19:00 Welcome from moinworld

19:10 Do women really need a special treatment? - Uygar Sönmez & Angela Kapdan

Uygar Sönmez was born in Wilhelmshaven, studied Computer Science in Hamburg, being a passionated Ruby on Rails Developer and a mom, Uygar, 37, is in her professional life the Director Engineering for the Premium Memberships at XING where she leads as a people manager a bunch of developers, QA engineers, Agile Project Managers and Team Leads. Having worked as Ruby on Rails Engineer in several teams before for building successful products, she gains experience in developing and also placing products on the market. Besides that Uygar also believes in young talents and therefore is training apprentices at XING as computer scientists as well as being active for motivating more girls and women for programming.

As a Product Manager, Angela Kapdan is responsible for several member acquisition products at XING. While studying environmental and economic law, she worked for Germany’s leading legal database, where she discovered her interest in online services. After completing her degree, she gained work experience in sales, project and product management spanning fields such as telecommunication, online marketing, coaching services as well as online shops. Besides her passion for agile methods and user-centric products, she is a speaker and mentor at the XING Mentor Month, an initiative that supports refugees entering the German job market.

19:30 Open Discussion

19:45 Break & Snacks in the beautiful Company Space

20:00 Networking & Feedback Session on the new Roof Skyline Terrasse

events.name: Girls Days in Hamburg - für Abiturientinnen und Abiturientinnen to be
events.description:
Euer Einstieg in die digitale Welt!
Wie schon im letzten Jahr organisieren wir ein Camp für Euch, in dem ihr IT Berufe und Hamburger Unternehmen kennen lernen könnt. Daneben habt ihr in Gruppen die Möglichkeit mehr über das Thema Programmieren zu lernen und Eure Kenntnisse je nach Kenntnisstand zu erweitern. Der Spaß steht im Vordergrund!

📅 Tag 1: Mittwoch den[masked]
Ort: Zentrale von XING SE, Dammtorstraße 30
Beginn: 9:30 Uhr (voraussichtliches Ende: 17 Uhr)
Lernt XING das Karrierenetzwerk als Arbeitgeber kennen. Wir machen zahlreiche Pausen in denen genug Zeit ist für eine Unternehmensführung und das Kennenlernen des Arbeitsalltags bei XING.
Inhalt: Am ersten Tag bekommt ihr einen Storytelling Workshop und lernt anschließend wie ihr einen Chatbot in Eure erstellte Geschichte einbinden könnt. Ihr erstellt Eure eigene Voice basierte Interaktion.
🎓Trainer: Margarita Esau, Doktorandin der Universität Siegen Bereich Human-Computer-Interaction und Peter Friese, Developer Advocate von Google

📅 Tag 2: Donnerstag den[masked]
Ort: Zentrale von Google, ABC-Strasse, Hamburg
Beginn: 9:30 Uhr (voraussichtliches Ende: 17 Uhr)
Lernt Google als Arbeitgeber kennen. Wir machen zahlreiche Pausen in denen genug Zeit ist für eine Unternehmensfühung und das Kennenlernen des Arbeitsalltags von Googlern.
Inhalt: Am zweiten Tag bekommt ihr einen Einstieg in die App-Entwicklung. Das Ziel soll es sein, dass ihr am Ende der drei Tage Eure eigens erstellte App auf Eurem Mobiltelefon Euren Freunden zeigen könnt.
🎓Trainer: Hanah, Jana, Sarah und Alexandra unterstützt von Peter Friese, Developer Advocate von Google

📅 Tag 3: Freitag den[masked]
Ort: SHARE NOW, Grosse Elbstrasse, Hamburg
Beginn: 9:30 Uhr (voraussichtliches Ende: 17 Uhr)
SHARE NOW (ehemals Car2Go) will das Autofahren revolutionieren. Lernt SHARE NOW als Arbeitgeber kennen. Wir machen zahlreiche Pausen in denen genug Zeit ist für eine Unternehmensfühung und das Kennenlernen des Arbeitsalltags von Mitarbeiterinnen bei SHARE NOW.
Inhalt: Am dritten Tag entwickeln wir unsere App weiter. Am Ende des Tages wird sie dann fertig zu präsentieren sein.
🎓Trainer: Hanah, Jana, Sarah und Alexandra unterstützt von Matthias Kim, Berater bei SAP

Um Euer leibliches Wohl ist gesorgt

--------------------------------

👉.. mehr Informationen und Anmeldung findet ihr hier: https://moinworld.de/girls-days-hamburg/
